intro: Gunnia septifraga, commonly known as the seven-fragmented gunnia, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It is a member of the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen shrub form. The plant features small, leathery leaves and produces clusters of white or pale pink flowers. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
